0.title: Spring 2020- App Developer Internship
0.body: POSITION SUMMARYThe Application Developer is responsible for developing software applications solutions for ADP's external and internal clients. Application Developers may be involved in all aspects of the software development life cycle (SDLC). Application Developers work with clients, product managers analysts, architects and engineers to plan, design, develop, test and implement information technology solutions consistent with the business objective.Application Developers may develop and review requirements, create design documents, write programs, package, test, configure and deploy software. Application Developers also participate and collaborate with other stakeholder including security, quality assurance, training, project management, engineering, hosting, & procurement when required to assist in other aspects of their projects.Application Developers at ADP are expected to be results-oriented, have knowledge of new and legacy technologies, have knowledge of the relevant platforms and environments, and be familiar with business process, functions and data within their domain to provide innovative, insightful, and secure solutions.We strive for every interaction to be driven by our CORE values: Insightful Expertise, Integrity is Everything, Service Excellence, Inspiring Innovation, Each Person Counts, Results-Driven, & Social Responsibility.RESPONSIBILITIES:Develop & enhance effective programs & data structures that successfully meet the objective.Participate effectively in relevant aspects of software development life cycle (SDLC) including planning, construction, testing, reviews and demonstrations.Collaborate with team to design, develop, test and refine deliverables.Investigate and resolve application issues as needed Package, configure and deploying software Collaborate with clients, Product Managers, Architects, & Analysts to develop and review requirements & design.Review and create system, software and functional design specifications that address requirements.Participate in project planning and release management.Higher level jobs would be expected to manage broader or multiple projects at a time.Acts as an expert source of technology and application knowledge within their domain. Research, recommend, and introduce new technologies and new uses of existing technologies Participating in Business planning, IT strategy and setting direction.Performs other related duties as assigned. 10-20% Travel required.Some situations may require more travels.Must be available to work evenings and weekends as needed.QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED:Technical Degree or equivalent in education & experience.3 - 5 years of directly related experience.Technical experience with Object Oriented Design and Development (Java, C++, etc), Web Technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, JSP, etc)Preference will be given to candidates who have the following:Technical Degree or equivalent in education & experience.3 - 5 years of directly related experience.Technical experience with Object Oriented Design and Development (Java, C++, etc), Web Technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, JSP, etc)Preference will be given to candidates who have the following:Web Application Development Background Experience with Relational Databases, scripting languages, UI / User Interface development experience and related technologies preferred.Uses resources to resolve routine issues regarding technology & business Resolves issues regarding relationships & leadership on own meritRelated Searches:Engineer Analyst Architect Data Scientist Application Developer Design Implementation Chief Principal Enterprise Specialist Infrastructure Research Development R&D Tech Associate Service Solutions Business Intelligence BI System Analyst Disaster Recovery Change Control IT Operations Information Performance Product Production QA Quality Assurance Release Service Statutory UX UI User Experience Interface Researcher Designer Service Project Software Test Program Programmer I&ORelated Searches:Engineer Analyst Architect Data Scientist Application Developer Design Implementation Chief Principal Enterprise Specialist Infrastructure Research Development R&D Tech Associate Service Solutions Business Intelligence BI System Analyst Disaster Recovery Change Control IT Operations Information Performance Product Production QA Quality Assurance Release Service Statutory UX UI User Experience Interface Researcher Designer Service Project Software Test Program Programmer I&OWe're designing a better way to work, so you can achieve what you're working for. Consistently named one of the 'Most Admired Companies' by FORTUNE® Magazine, and recognized by DiversityInc® as one of the 'Top 50 Companies for Diversity,' ADP works with more than 740,000 organizations across the globe to help their people work smarter, embrace new challenges, and unleash their talent. "Always Designing for People" means we're creating platforms that will transform how great work gets done, so together we can unlock a world of opportunity.At ADP, we believe that diversity fuels innovation. ADP is committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, genetic information, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, lawful alien status, national origin, age, marital status, or protected veteran status. We support an inclusive workplace where associates excel based on personal merit, qualifications, experience, ability, and job performance.

1.title: Business Automation Application Developer - Coding Skills Non-Mandatory
1.body: We are the developer of the world-leading, next-generation, no-to-low-code application platform that enables organizations to rapidly create hundreds to thousands of new business automation applications to accelerate the transformation into a digital business.“In short, Software is eating the world.” – Marc Andreessen“Every business will become a software business . . .” – Satya Nadella, CEO, Microsoft“Every business is, willingly or unwillingly, a competitor on a software playing field . . .” - Harvard Business ReviewThe sheer demand to modernize existing legacy applications and create new ones go way beyond what we can expect from the capacity of traditional IT and newThe no-to-low-code development trend emerged to revolutionize software development and enable cross-discipline innovation. Many low-code platforms only aim to deliver higher development productivity for IT by leveraging prior code-generation techniques. Our platform aims to also democratize the application development to empower business subject matter experts (or Citizens Developers) to innovate while collaborating with IT.Read more about our platform: https://drive.google.com/open?id=1vdSIQoZqyXucoatzBOwQeCnKE3iIo9hGRead how ‘Turning Application Development Upside Down’ is the future -https://drive.google.com/open?id=1l5ma87iWM2TrlC-GY7SwX1YiLu7xd7QoAs a market leader, we faced a strong demand for a new generation of business-minded application developers to best leverage the empowerment and the innovation no-to-low-code trend can bring. We are looking for highly motivated, self-driven young graduates to join us. You will go through a 3-month training to learn this latest innovation until you can develop business applications, without coding, for our customers.If you are a developer, we also need you. You will be part of enhancing and expanding our no-to-low-code platform (yes, with coding) so we can continue to push the envelope by adding more advanced functionality with no-code ease of use.If interested, please reply with a cover letter and a copy of your resume.Join us and experience the power of the future.Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Internship, ContractSalary: $50,000.00 to $90,000.00 /yearExperience:Business Analysis: 1 year (Preferred)

2.title: Software Engineer Intern
2.body: What You Will DoGain experience in the software development field! Duties may include reading and documenting code, assisting with testing and fixing bugs, updating setup documents, importing files, learning various aspects of software development and assisting the Software Engineering team where needed. Our fast-paced, innovative, collaborative and dynamic environment stimulates the creation of custom software for our customers to improve their whole shipping process. Our customers save money, are more efficient and have access to real-time data.Who We AreRateLinx is a thought-leader in customized supply chain management software and logistics consulting. Simply put, we are a team of problem-solvers. At RateLinx we bring novel supply chain solutions using the Logistics in 3D process: Diagnose, Develop, Deploy. We listen, we ask the right questions, and we use integrated data to get to the root cause of the problem. We do not skip to deployment in a one-size-fits-all approach.We are transforming our clients’ supply chain processes. We connect all of our clients’ logistics data and deliver actionable intelligence to optimize strategies that give our clients a competitive advantage and huge savings.At RateLinx, our values drive the culture. We embrace Creativity, Knowledge, and Confidence; they are critical to our success. We are Reliable, Responsive, and Nimble to meet the individual needs of our clients. We Collaborate to solve our clients’ supply chain problems. Our values help us achieve our goal to Be The Best.Who You AreYou embrace our culture and share our values. You are working towards an Associate or Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field and have the ability to read code. You have the desire to gain software development experience in a fast-paced, innovative, collaborative and dynamic environment. With strong attention to detail and initiative, you’ll have the knowledge and confidence to ask the right questions, so problems, issues or concerns are addressed quickly before they occur or become critical. With drive, determination, and a self-disciplined approach to achieving results, you’ll present new ideas and concepts after carefully analyzing and testing themWhy Work for RateLinx:Besides being a part of a great team dedicated to optimizing our customers’ supply chains, check this out:We are located on the East side of Madison off of American Parkway – we are close to restaurants, gas stations, clinic, new hospital, shopping, etc. Take advantage of the pedestrian trail system right outside our building.Dress Code is casual.Free coffee, tea and snacks.Hours to be mutually agreed upon between Team Leader and Intern.Job Type: Internship

5.title: Software Engineer Intern
5.body: If revolutionizing healthcare excites you, join our growing team and help us achieve our mission to build better software for doctors and patients and improve healthcare for all. DrChrono's Engineering team plays a critical role delivering innovative products from inception to mass adoption. You’ll be able to learn to build things working closely with product as well as create production quality code. We have the mind and soul of SaaS startup and you’ll be able to build world class software that delights users and can scale to millions of people. The ideal candidate will be eager in a fluid start-up environment and will bring an energetic, fun and creative approach to their work.About the CompanyDrChrono was founded and is led by two software engineers, Michael Nusimow and Daniel Kivatinos. Unlike other healthcare companies, our company is built from the ground up to address modern healthcare through technology and innovation. We believe in open APIs and being part of an open ecosystem.We are a YCombinator funded Silicon Valley startup working out of the Chronoplex in Sunnyvale, CA and Hunt Valley, Maryland. Since our inception, we have attracted over 100k physicians, 10 million patients, and have been to the White House to discuss how technology can solve healthcare problems as part of the Obama Administration’s Precision Medicine Initiative . So far we’ve booked 20+ million patient appointments and processed 1.5 billion dollars in medical billing per year. DrChrono is ranked by INC 500 as one of the fastest growing private companies in America. We are an official Apple Mobility Partner with our industry leading EHR (Electronic Health Records) iPad app.Silicon Valley Business Journal designated DrChrono as one of the fastest growing private companies and was voted the #1 mobile Electronic Health Record 5 years in a row by Black Book Rankings.About the Internship...We require that our interns work on-site at our Chronoplex in Sunnyvale, CAThis role requires 10-12 hours a weekInternship will begin Wednesday, January 29, 2020What You'll Learn...Domain Knowledge on EHRProject managementProduct processesCoding Skills on React.js or Graph QLHow to write production quality code

8.title: 2020 Software Engineering Summer Internship
8.body: 2020 Software Engineering Summer InternshipOur interns don’t go with the flow. They aren’t content with “average,” and they already have their sights set on changing the world. Our interns don’t believe in “boring,” and they laugh in the face of the status quo.Our interns?They shift the tide.At Royal Caribbean Cruises, we offer an 11-week paid, skill-enriching, innovation-generating summer advantage. Our interns innovate, collaborate and deliver. Looking for an internship where you’ll fill coffee orders and file papers? This isn’t the one. We’re counting on our interns to bring fresh ideas and own exciting projects in the works.Still not hooked? Let’s talk about the perks. Philanthropy days, exclusive events, transportation incentives, and the most incredible view of Miami in the city. From stunning beaches to drool-worthy Cuban food, a summer in Miami is one you’ll never forget.As an intern at our corporate headquarters, you’ll be part of a top-notch global workforce. You will be exposed to real life business situations and work on projects alongside our employees, all the while learning relevant skills that will make your resume look good.Your summer will include ship visits, community projects, and even a chance to pick the brain of executives during Executive Spotlights. You’ll have a chance to gain insight into how we create the products, systems and services that help deliver the best vacations at sea. This is an internship where you won’t come out empty-handed… or empty-brained.Ready to change the future of your career? Think you’re up to the challenge?

9.title: Software Engineer Intern
9.body: Job Overview:At Rapid7, we want Software Engineers that think beyond the code. Our goal is to provide value to our customers and we ask every engineer to have a voice in how we provide that value. We want passionate and humble individuals that want to make a difference in the DevOps, IT and Security industries. You don't need prior security knowledge - our primary challenges are data pipelining, attribution, visualization and scale.As an intern, you will learn about security and software. You will be treated as any other developer on the team (no coffee runs or BS projects). You will join a team and help contribute to a product that is deployed to thousands of organizations (large and small). You will learn and you will teach us as well.Job Responsibilities:Build amazing productsBring a positive mindset, undeterred and unafraid of failureParticipate in a cross-functional team environment that continually collaborates and improvesJob Qualifications:Obtaining a BS/MS in Computer Science (or similar)Some experience in Java or similar languagePassionate about building software, ambitious and humbleTeam-oriented, possess a positive attitude and works well with othersOutstanding communication skills, both written and oral

10.title: Software Engineer Intern
10.body: Position SummaryDocuSign is seeking Software Engineer Interns to help build and enhance our product offerings and infrastructure over the course of a 12-week paid internship (start/end dates flexible). You will be a member of a small, focused team that is working to improve the scalability of our infrastructure, create reliable REST APIs, build necessary product features, implement elegant user interactions, or supplement our automated test systems. Each intern will have a dedicated mentor who, along with the team's developers, QA engineers, product managers, and/or designers, will teach and guide you as you make improvements that will ship prior to the end of your internship.ResponsibilitiesResponsibilities will differ by team, you may:Create, integrate, and consume DocuSign APIs in C#.Implement front-end features consuming the API in JavaScript.Create and use Powershell to automate build, test, and other internal processes.Build internal tools using Powershell, Ruby, or Javascript.Write and update SQL stored procedures (Microsoft SQL Server).Write unit tests to ensure the quality of the code.Identify and automate test cases and improve existing integration testing processes.Demo your project to the Engineering team at the end of your internship.Basic QualificationsCurrently pursuing a degree in Computer Science or a related technical field.Completed courses focused on Data Structures and Algorithms.Preferred QualificationsCoding and design experience, preferably in an OO programming language like C#, Java, C++.Experience with C#, Java, JavaScript, or Ruby.Experience with consuming and building RESTful web services.Experience with git, continuous integration, and deployment tools.Experience in unit testing.Excellent communication skills.Engineering @DocuSignA problem that takes 5 minutes to solve is not interesting. A problem that takes 5 years to solve is fun. We like to think about complex, global challenges that cross cultures and legal jurisdictions and that impact millions of people and businesses. We hire people with a broad set of skills, and they are working on how to create never-been-done-before solutions that scale. We are creating revolutionary solutions that change the way people work, live and connect … and we see our work go live. We see its impact.About DocuSignDocuSign® is changing how business gets done by empowering hundreds of thousands of companies and tens of millions of users in most countries around the world to sign, send and manage documents anytime, anywhere, on any device with confidence. DocuSign replaces printing, faxing, scanning and overnighting documents with the easiest, fastest, most trusted way to make every approval and decision digital. Organizations of all sizes and industries are accelerating contracts, approvals and workflows with DocuSign's Digital Transaction Management (DTM) platform and eSignature solution. DocuSign keeps life and business moving forward.DocuSign is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Individuals seeking employment at DocuSign are considered without regards to race, ethnicity, color, age, sex, religion, national origin, ancestry, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, physical or mental disability, registered domestic partner status, caregiver status, marital status, veteran or military status, citizenship status, or any other legally protected category.About DocuSignDocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they prepare, sign, act on, and manage agreements. As part of the DocuSign Agreement Cloud, DocuSign offers eSignature: the world's #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from almost anywhere, at any time. Today, more than 500,000 customers and hundreds of millions of users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and to simplify people's lives.#LI-DS1

11.title: Software Engineer Intern

13.title: Software Engineer Intern
13.body: AtHewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE), we bring together the brightest minds to create breakthrough technology solutions and advance the way people live and work. Our legacy inspires us as we forge ahead dedicated to helping our customers make their mark on the world.Learning does not only happen through training. Relationships are among the most powerful ways for people to learn and grow, and this is part of our HPE culture. In addition to working alongside talented colleagues, you will have many opportunities to learn through coaching and stretch assignment opportunities. You’ll be guided by feedback and support to accelerate your learning and maximize your knowledge. We also have a “reverse mentoring” program which allows us to share our knowledge and strengths across our multi-generation workforce.College/University Graduate hires (within 12 months of graduation per the company's definition) undergoing a specific training and development path within the EMEA Graduate Program.Description:This internship involves working with the Chapel Programming Language team to help develop Chapel viaimprovements to its compiler, libraries, tools, and documentation with the goal of making parallel programming from laptops to Crays as accessible as programming in Python. For more information on Chapel, please refer to https://chapel-lang.orgMore specifically, the Chapel Team is looking to hire enthusiastic summer interns with a passion for designing, implementing, testing, documenting, evangelizing, and optimizing parallel programming languages. The ideal candidate will be interested in doing work in the areas of compiler development, runtime, standard library support, tools, test-driven development, and/or performance debugging and optimization. Knowledge of C/C++ is highly desirable. We will consider undergraduates and masters students looking for a practical programming experiences in an R&D setting as well as Ph.D. students working in related research areas. In applying for the position, please describe your areas of interest in working on Chapel.These internships run during the summer months for 3-4 months between academic sessions. This position is located in Seattle, WA.Education and Experience Required:High School Degree 4th Year of University completed-typically a technical degree specialization.We offer:A competitive salary and extensive social benefitsDiverse and dynamic work environmentWork-life balance and support for career developmentAn amazing life inside the element! Want to know more about it?Then let’s stay connected!https://www.facebook.com/HPECareershttps://twitter.com/HPE_Careers1058837

14.title: Summer Software Engineer
14.body: Heartbeat Health is a venture-funded health tech startup in New York City. We are working to deliver the most effective, efficient, and delightful cardiovascular disease prevention in the world. More than 80% of cardiovascular disease deaths are attributable to preventable factors, yet cardiovascular disease is the costliest and deadliest worldwide because its prevention is neither obvious nor easy. Our team consists of passionate and proven physicians, engineers, scientists, designers, and founders attacking this problem from first principles, applying human-centered design, and developing evidence-based AI to solve this global issue. We have been featured in TechCrunch, CNBC, and Forbes.Our experience with thousands of patients has helped to shape our approach and reinforce our belief that ground-breaking technology and human touch are both essential elements of truly transformative healthcare. We also recognize that stepwise progress requires addressing the two major drivers of cardiovascular disease prevention, knowledge and behavior. Therefore, we are creating a mobile product that continuously measures cardiovascular risk factors to determine individual risk from population risk models. Our members follow easy steps to improve their heart health and receive feedback from a network of world-class cardiologists empowered with data-driven insights. This simple idea of connecting people and technology with purpose gives every Heartbeat user the superpower to save a million lives.Our cultureBe amazing at what you do, without ego.Take ownership and be accountable to yourself and the team.Move fast with our stakeholders' best interests at heart.Be open to a breadth of ideas, but focused on delivery.Measure and improve what really matters.Be candid and honest with people.Demonstrate high integrity, always.Help others and appreciate those who help you.Be a kind and decent human.Have fun.The Heartbeat Summer Intern program is accepting applications that meet the following qualifications:Currently a student in an undergrad or grad program, studying computer science, engineering, math, or related technical majorHave at least one semester of course work remainingExperience in (and passion for) working on complex problems in healthcareStrong time management and organizational skillsAbility to pick up new skills quickly and can be a self starter

15.title: Software Engineer Summer Internship 2020

16.title: Software Engineer Intern - Augmented Reality
16.body: Bigger challenges. Bolder ideas. Global impact. At Viasat, we're on a mission to deliver connections with the capacity to change the world. We're the company behind the world's fastest satellite internet service, with technology that's helping to bridge the digital divide and improve life for our customers around the globe. By providing powerful new ways for people to connect with one another, gain greater access to education, entertainment, medical research, commerce, and much more, our team is empowering millions of customers worldwide.We're growing rapidly and looking for passionate, innovative professionals to join our team and connect the world to more. 18.title: Become a Software Developer. No Experience Needed
18.body: Have you heard that “you need a college degree to get a job in the technology field?” Do you think you can’t land a high-paying job unless you already know someone who works there? Or have you been told that “technology jobs aren’t for people like you?”At Catalyte, we built a company on a belief that some of the best technology professionals come from unexpected places. We find the people that others overlook. And we provide a software development training program, at no cost to participants, to teach computer programming skills. Then, we hire successful graduates as entry-level software developers. You’ll work on client projects, surrounded by a supportive team of more experienced tech professionals who make sure you’re confident and ready to keep building your skills and a career.We’re currently looking for people to join our next training class, which will most likely begin in spring 2020. If you’re a curious and creative person who loves solving problems and being part of something bigger than yourself, we invite you to take our online screening to see if you might be a fit for us, too.What We Look ForHigh school diploma or GEDAt least 18 years oldU.S. citizen or eligible to work in the U.S. (Catalyte does not offer visa assistance or sponsorship)Free of illegal drug use for at least eighteen monthsNo prior felonyCompensationThere is no charge for the training. At successful completion of training, you will be given a 2-year apprenticeship paying in the $17-$18/hour range. Upon successful completion of the apprenticeship you will be adjusted to market rate typically between $65k-$80k.How to ApplyFirst, complete our two-hour online screening. It has math, logic, reading comprehension, and personality questions. Don’t worry about getting every question right; just focus on answering all the questions. Your responses help us figure out whether you could be a good fit to learn and succeed in software development. https://learn.catalyte.io/More About CatalyteCatalyte was founded 19 years ago on a belief that aptitude is equally distributed, but opportunity is not. We use artificial intelligence to identify individuals, of all backgrounds, who have the potential and ability to be great software developers. Through our training and employment program, we seek to create a ready-to-hire workforce that is diverse, skilled, and valuable. View coverage of Catalyte on 60 Minutes https://catalyte.io/catalyte-on-60-minutes/To learn more,Visit our website: https://catalyte.io/Job Types: Full-time, InternshipSalary: $65,000.00 to $80,000.00 /yearLocation:Baltimore, MD (Required)Language:English (Required)Work authorization:United States (Required)Visa Sponsorship Potentially Available:No: Not providing sponsorship for this jobThis Job Is Ideal for Someone Who Is:Dependable -- more reliable than spontaneousAdaptable/flexible -- enjoys doing work that requires frequent shifts in directionAchievement-oriented -- enjoys taking on challenges, even if they might failPeople-oriented -- enjoys interacting with people and working on group projectsThis Company Describes Its Culture as:Outcome-oriented -- results-focused with strong performance culturePeople-oriented -- supportive and fairness-focusedTeam-oriented -- cooperative and collaborativeThis Job Is:A job for which military experienced candidates are encouraged to applyA good fit for applicants with gaps in their resume, or who have been out of the workforce for the past 6 months or moreA good job for someone just entering the workforce or returning to the workforce with limited experience and educationA job for which all ages, including older job seekers, are encouraged to applyOpen to applicants who do not have a college diploma

20.title: Business Automation Application Developer - Coding Skills Non-Mandatory
20.body: We are the developer of the world-leading, next-generation, no-to-low-code application platform that enables organizations to rapidly create hundreds to thousands of new business automation applications to accelerate the transformation into a digital business.“In short, Software is eating the world.” – Marc Andreessen“Every business will become a software business . . .” – Satya Nadella, CEO, Microsoft“Every business is, willingly or unwillingly, a competitor on a software playing field . . .” - Harvard Business ReviewThe sheer demand to modernize existing legacy applications and create new ones go way beyond what we can expect from the capacity of traditional IT and newThe no-to-low-code development trend emerged to revolutionize software development and enable cross-discipline innovation. 25.title: Intern - Software Engineer (Development & Testing)
25.body: All submissions MUST include GPA for consideration.Corvid Technologies is seeking qualified candidates for an internship working with our Ballistic Missile Defense (BMD) Group. The BMD Group supports a variety of government (Missile Defense Agency, Navy Missile Defense) programs through modeling and simulation, testing, and system analysis related to the defense of the homeland and military assets from ballistic missile threats. Corvid’s BMD analysis includes missile intercept modeling using first-principle physics codes, aerodynamic modeling of missiles and debris, development of finite element models, computational electromagnetics modeling, modeling of BMDS radars, modeling of BMDS interceptor seekers, and analysis of BMDS sensor data (RF and EO/IR).Example ResponsibilitiesCoordinating all activities related to setup and maintenance of the development test environmentWork directly with developers to write complex test casesIdentify and troubleshoot possible problemsEnsure the overall quality of the productBasic QualificationsA candidate must meet ALL of the below criteria. The candidate must:Be a student who is enrolled full-time and pursuing an undergraduate or graduate (preferred) degree from an accredited college/university AND graduating after August 2020Be majoring in Software Engineering, Computer Science or related field.Have an overall cumulative GPA of 3.0/4.0 or higher (unofficial academic transcripts must be provided at time of application by uploading the documents to your application or profile)Be available to work full-time (40 hours per week) for at least 10 weeks during summer.Be able to obtain a U.S. Government security clearance (U.S. citizenship is a pre-requisite)PreferredHave an overall cumulative GPA of 3.70/4.0 or higherExperience with scientific programming languages (e.g. Matlab, Python, C++)Experience with modeling and simulation softwareStrong background in object-oriented programming; Knowledge of Visual Studio Code, LinuxPrevious internship/co-op experience, leadership & teamwork capabilities, interpersonal communication skills, and activities (professional/community/extracurricular)About Corvid:Corvid is a small business that provides technology-based solutions to a diverse customer base ranging from the Missile Defense Agency to NASCAR. We are a group of over 140 engineers and scientists, about 3/4ths with master’s degrees or Ph.D.’s, that provide end-to-end solutions including concept development, design and optimization, prototype build, test, and manufacture. We leverage the predictive capability of our high-fidelity computational physics solvers, indigenous massively parallel supercomputer system, prototyping plant, and ballistics and mechanics lab to investigate a variety of high-rate physics phenomena. The results are complex engineering solutions for a variety of applications; aircraft, ballistic missile defense, motorsports, armor development, biological systems, and missile and warhead design and development. These results are achieved with optimal design and cost efficiency due to the predictive capability of Corvid’s tools and our in-house, end-to-end integrated approach, which differentiates Corvid from the market. Please visit our website for more information, www.corvidtec.comAll qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.Job Type: InternshipLocation:Huntsville, AL (Required)License:U.S. SECRET or TOP SECRET Security Clearance (Required)Work authorization:United States (Required)

5 years of directly related experience.Technical experience with Object Oriented Design and Development (Java, C++, etc), Web Technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, JSP, etc)Preference will be given to candidates who have the following:Technical Degree or equivalent in education & experience.3 - 41.title: Intern - Software Engineer (Development & Testing)
41.body: All submissions MUST include GPA for consideration.Corvid Technologies is seeking qualified candidates for an internship working with our Ballistic Missile Defense (BMD) Group. The BMD Group supports a variety of government (Missile Defense Agency, Navy Missile Defense) programs through modeling and simulation, testing, and system analysis related to the defense of the homeland and military assets from ballistic missile threats. Corvid’s BMD analysis includes missile intercept modeling using first-principle physics codes, aerodynamic modeling of missiles and debris, development of finite element models, computational electromagnetics modeling, modeling of BMDS radars, modeling of BMDS interceptor seekers, and analysis of BMDS sensor data (RF and EO/IR).Example ResponsibilitiesCoordinating all activities related to setup and maintenance of the development test environmentWork directly with developers to write complex test casesIdentify and troubleshoot possible problemsEnsure the overall quality of the productBasic QualificationsA candidate must meet ALL of the below criteria. The candidate must:Be a student who is enrolled full-time and pursuing an undergraduate or graduate (preferred) degree from an accredited college/university AND graduating after August 2020Be majoring in Software Engineering, Computer Science or related field.Have an overall cumulative GPA of 3.0/4.0 or higher (unofficial academic transcripts must be provided at time of application by uploading the documents to your application or profile)Be available to work full-time (40 hours per week) for at least 10 weeks during summer.Be able to obtain a U.S. Government security clearance (U.S. citizenship is a pre-requisite)PreferredHave an overall cumulative GPA of 3.70/4.0 or higherExperience with scientific programming languages (e.g. Matlab, Python, C++)Experience with modeling and simulation softwareStrong background in object-oriented programming; Knowledge of Visual Studio Code, LinuxPrevious internship/co-op experience, leadership & teamwork capabilities, interpersonal communication skills, and activities (professional/community/extracurricular)About Corvid:Corvid is a small business that provides technology-based solutions to a diverse customer base ranging from the Missile Defense Agency to NASCAR. We are a group of over 140 engineers and scientists, about 3/4ths with master’s degrees or Ph.D.’s, that provide end-to-end solutions including concept development, design and optimization, prototype build, test, and manufacture. We leverage the predictive capability of our high-fidelity computational physics solvers, indigenous massively parallel supercomputer system, prototyping plant, and ballistics and mechanics lab to investigate a variety of high-rate physics phenomena. The results are complex engineering solutions for a variety of applications; aircraft, ballistic missile defense, motorsports, armor development, biological systems, and missile and warhead design and development. These results are achieved with optimal design and cost efficiency due to the predictive capability of Corvid’s tools and our in-house, end-to-end integrated approach, which differentiates Corvid from the market. Please visit our website for more information, www.corvidtec.comAll qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.Job Type: InternshipLocation:Huntsville, AL (Required)License:U.S. SECRET or TOP SECRET Security Clearance (Required)Work authorization:United States (Required)

43.title: Business Automation Application Developer - Coding Skills Non-Mandatory
43.body: We are the developer of the world-leading, next-generation, no-to-low-code application platform that enables organizations to rapidly create hundreds to thousands of new business automation applications to accelerate the transformation into a digital business.“In short, Software is eating the world.” – Marc Andreessen“Every business will become a software business . . .” – Satya Nadella, CEO, Microsoft“Every business is, willingly or unwillingly, a competitor on a software playing field . . .” - Harvard Business ReviewThe sheer demand to modernize existing legacy applications and create new ones go way beyond what we can expect from the capacity of traditional IT and newThe no-to-low-code development trend emerged to revolutionize software development and enable cross-discipline innovation. Many low-code platforms only aim to deliver higher development productivity for IT by leveraging prior code-generation techniques. Our platform aims to also democratize the application development to empower business subject matter experts (or Citizens Developers) to innovate while collaborating with IT.Read more about our platform: https://drive.google.com/open?id=1vdSIQoZqyXucoatzBOwQeCnKE3iIo9hGRead how ‘Turning Application Development Upside Down’ is the future -https://drive.google.com/open?id=1l5ma87iWM2TrlC-GY7SwX1YiLu7xd7QoAs a market leader, we faced a strong demand for a new generation of business-minded application developers to best leverage the empowerment and the innovation no-to-low-code trend can bring. We are looking for highly motivated, self-driven young graduates to join us. You will go through a 3-month training to learn this latest innovation until you can develop business applications, without coding, for our customers.If you are a developer, we also need you. You will be part of enhancing and expanding our no-to-low-code platform (yes, with coding) so we can continue to push the envelope by adding more advanced functionality with no-code ease of use.If interested, please reply with a cover letter and a copy of your resume.Join us and experience the power of the future.Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Internship, ContractSalary: $50,000.00 to $90,000.00 /yearExperience:Business Analysis: 1 year (Preferred)

Sometimes they even provide an opportunity to change the world and save lives. Those are the missions we care about.As a leading technology innovation company, Lockheed Martin’s vast team works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers’ toughest challenges. 53.title: WINTER Internship - Frontend (Web) Engineering
53.body: About VerkadaAt Verkada, we’re rethinking what it means to be physically safe. Today, we build security cameras that detect action, identify danger and help keep people and places safe and secure. Using a combination of software and hardware, we’re transforming an industry that has seen little innovation for decades—and we already support thousands of customers. But this is just the beginning. We envision a world in which security systems feel as seamless and modern as the organizations they protect and our enterprise solution becomes a model for not just business security, but public security as well.Click here to view one of our live cameras!The RoleNOTE: This is for a WINTER internship (January - April).Verkada is looking for software engineering interns to join our team for an exciting and challenging internship. We are seeking interns who will thrive in a startup culture working alongside teammates to launch products that will be utilized by customers across the globe. As an intern working with the Frontend (Web) Engineering team, you’ll be working on one or more projects on various teams including backend/infrastructure, mobile, firmware, or frontend/UI. You will have opportunities to work across the full software stack and collaborate cross functionally to build the latest iterations of Verkada’s flagship software enabling our best-in-class security systems.The Frontend (Web) team is responsible for Verkada's front-end applications which help deliver mission-critical video from our cloud-connected cameras to our customers 24/7. This position involves working heavily in JavaScript and Typescript as well as interacting with our computer vision and video APIs.Check out a profile of one of our current interns - Caileen Dolan from Waterloo!ResponsibilitiesImplement production-facing features used by our customers every day.Fix bugs.Some current and future example intern projects:Work with computer vision engineers to experiment with machine learning and AI data models and applications.Maintain the offline processing queue for reliably generating video exports in the face of unreliable remote connections.Specify and add API endpoints to change camera image tuning properties.Work with real-time data connections between camera cloud user.Maintain and implement testing automation and testing frameworks.Maintain high-performance, multiplexing video transcoding services.Work cross-functionally to solve problems outside of your normal scope.Required SkillsInternship experience developing and launching products.Experience building reusable components, utilizing CSS pre-processors and building pixel perfect user interfaces.Comfortable working in an agile team software development environment.Deep understanding of JavaScript, including contexts, prototypes/classes and closures.Experience working with a modern web framework such as Angular.js, React or Vue.Familiarity with REST APIs, ability to read python server code a plus!About our teamBehind the scenes, we’re a team of computer scientists, hardware engineers and experienced founders who saw a chance to make a real impact. We’re united by the challenge of building beautiful products, designed for real people—and by our commitment to using technology responsibly. We believe keeping data private and secure is core to our safety as individuals, businesses and communities and we put great care into building systems that embody our values as people. Likewise, many of Silicon Valley’s top investors believe in us: we’re backed by Sequoia Capital, FirstRound, Meritech and Siemens (Next47).Verkada is an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status, and encourage all qualified applicants to apply.

61.title: Intern - Software Engineer (Development & Testing)
61.body: All submissions MUST include GPA for consideration.Corvid Technologies is seeking qualified candidates for an internship working with our Ballistic Missile Defense (BMD) Group. The BMD Group supports a variety of government (Missile Defense Agency, Navy Missile Defense) programs through modeling and simulation, testing, and system analysis related to the defense of the homeland and military assets from ballistic missile threats. Corvid’s BMD analysis includes missile intercept modeling using first-principle physics codes, aerodynamic modeling of missiles and debris, development of finite element models, computational electromagnetics modeling, modeling of BMDS radars, modeling of BMDS interceptor seekers, and analysis of BMDS sensor data (RF and EO/IR).Example ResponsibilitiesCoordinating all activities related to setup and maintenance of the development test environmentWork directly with developers to write complex test casesIdentify and troubleshoot possible problemsEnsure the overall quality of the productBasic QualificationsA candidate must meet ALL of the below criteria. The candidate must:Be a student who is enrolled full-time and pursuing an undergraduate or graduate (preferred) degree from an accredited college/university AND graduating after August 2020Be majoring in Software Engineering, Computer Science or related field.Have an overall cumulative GPA of 3.0/4.0 or higher (unofficial academic transcripts must be provided at time of application by uploading the documents to your application or profile)Be available to work full-time (40 hours per week) for at least 10 weeks during summer.Be able to obtain a U.S. Government security clearance (U.S. citizenship is a pre-requisite)PreferredHave an overall cumulative GPA of 3.70/4.0 or higherExperience with scientific programming languages (e.g. Matlab, Python, C++)Experience with modeling and simulation softwareStrong background in object-oriented programming; Knowledge of Visual Studio Code, LinuxPrevious internship/co-op experience, leadership & teamwork capabilities, interpersonal communication skills, and activities (professional/community/extracurricular)About Corvid:Corvid is a small business that provides technology-based solutions to a diverse customer base ranging from the Missile Defense Agency to NASCAR. We are a group of over 140 engineers and scientists, about 3/4ths with master’s degrees or Ph.D.’s, that provide end-to-end solutions including concept development, design and optimization, prototype build, test, and manufacture. We leverage the predictive capability of our high-fidelity computational physics solvers, indigenous massively parallel supercomputer system, prototyping plant, and ballistics and mechanics lab to investigate a variety of high-rate physics phenomena. The results are complex engineering solutions for a variety of applications; aircraft, ballistic missile defense, motorsports, armor development, biological systems, and missile and warhead design and development. In addition, you will take responsibility for daily tasks similar to those a permanent Programmer/Analyst would perform, which will provide you with the opportunity to see how a technology career within the financial services industry will start. Upon completion of the internship, you will have an understanding of how data plays a critical part in making key business decisions in the financial industry and how it adds value to our customers. You will see how the business and technical side of application development come together to create impactful and actionable information and how the technology is maintained and developed in order to keep it competitive in the marketplace.In this role, candidate will have the opportunity to be involved in various stages of software development lifecycle:Work with product team to define and document specific data requirements and business logic to build relevant products within GMGParticipate and contribute to solution architecture and design specifications of applications, microservices, data pipelines, analytics use cases, etc.Develop applications and services with test automation, possible technologies include ASP.NET Core, Java, JavaScript, SQL, etc.Assist with solution deployment and maintenance in local and AWS cloudWhat we're looking forWe seek candidates with diverse background and ideas with a desire to learn and thrive. The Summer Internship Program will provide you with a variety of experiences to help you identify your strengths, develop highly transferable skills and align you to a successful career path for a bright future at HIS Markit.To be eligible for the Summer Internship:You are working towards completing a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree (or equivalent) no later than September 2021This program is aimed at students with 0-6 months relevant work experienceDemonstrate passion or interest in one or more of our key industries, especially Financial ServicesExcellent communication skillsStrong critical thinking and problem-solving skillsAn ability to learn and adapt quickly in a rapidly changing environmentThe ability to build strong working relationships in a collaborative settingBe legally eligible to work for the duration of the program in the country for which you applyFor our Technology Stream applicants, we recommend the following:A Science, Technology, Engineering or Math related degreeAn understanding and interest in the following:Software development methodologiesSolution architectureDevelopment with ASP.Net, Java, JavaScript, and data platformsInfrastructureQuality assuranceHow to applySubmit your online application, which should include your CVApplication and assessment processThe assessment process that follows is designed to ensure you can learn more about us, showcase your skills and find a role that is right for you.Stage 1:Submit online applicationStage 2:Initial screening processStage 3:Final stage assessment dayYou may be considered for multiple suitable roles throughout this process. If these roles fall within the same stream, you will be assessed during the same process. If the roles fall across multiple streams, you may be asked to complete different assessments aligned to those roles.We recruit on a rolling basis and most of our assessment days are due to take place from November 2019. We recommend early application.Our commitment to diversityOur business and our customers are diverse, and we believe that embracing a diverse and inclusive environment is key to defining who we are. Our people are what makes us unique and you will get the opportunity to work with some of the brightest minds from across the world who continuously find the best possible solutions, adding value and driving change for our customers.-IHS Markit is committed to providing equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by the laws and regulations in any of our locations.We are proud to provide reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities. 81.title: Software Engineering/ Data/ Product Internship General Summer 2020 Opportunities
81.body: Position SummaryAbout Discovery DigitalDiscovery's Digital group is a well-funded start-up within Discovery, Inc. We are fast, nimble, and have fun developing new and innovative digital products and content for iconic brands. Working at the crossroads of technology, entertainment, and every day utility, we are redefining the direct-to-consumer experience. As content creators across the digital ecosystem, we continuously leverage technology to create immersive viewing and interactive experiences. We tell engaging stories to millions of viewers across all platforms every day and bring new experiences to life to not only entertain, but improve the lives of our customers. Discovery has 17 authenticated TV Everywhere Apps/Sites that super-serve fans AND advertisers alike. We also are currently the home of five direct-to-consumer products globally—Food Network Kitchen, MotorTrend, GolfTV, Eurosport Player and DPLAY, with plans to launch additional products in the US over the next 12 months.About the Discovery Intern ProgramDiscovery Interns are explorers; they dive headfirst into the world in front of them. They aren’t afraid to be uncomfortable and boldly embrace any obstacle or challenge as an opportunity to excel. They walk confidently into the uncharted territory and make the most of their experiences. They ask the questions that go beyond the surface.Seek adventure, find your passion, forge your path with an Internship at Discovery.Through Discovery’s Internship Program, you’ll have the unique opportunity to immerse yourself in the entertainment and media industry and learn from the leader in global entertainment.Here’s what we offer:Opportunity to immerse yourself and get your hands dirty with challenging work and projectsMentorship from Discovery’s best and brightestIntern Speaker Series featuring top executives and employees across the businessNetworking opportunities with great snacksA creative, collaborative and inclusive company culture with office spaces to matchHere’s what you’ll take away:Opportunity to develop professionally and uncover skills you didn’t know you hadThe insider scoop on the TV industry and what happens behind the scenesRelationships that will go beyond your collegiate careerReal life experiences that will provide you with the confidence to delve into your next adventureResponsibilitiesWe are rapidly growing our direct to consumer divisions and are seekingsoftware engineering, data science, analytics, product management & designtalent for internship opportunities in Knoxville, Tennessee.Client (Frontend Engineering) Team:As a frontend engineering intern, you could help build rich UX across Web, Android, iOS, FireTV, tvOS, Roku and future platforms. Background in design and a firm understanding of how to profile animation to reduce and avoid jank is crucial to the success of this role. Our client technology stack includes ReactJS and React Native. We love working with modern tools and sharing our experiences with the community.Services (Backend Engineering) Team:As a backend engineering intern within our Services Engineering team you could help implement microservices applications that focus on content delivery, user entitlements, personalization and data. This is a fantastic opportunity to help solve complex but interesting scalability, performance and resiliency problems for products consumed by millions of users! You will have the opportunity to work with a suite of great technologies and in a highly collaborative environment. Our technology stack includes Golang, MariaDB, MongoDB, AWS (SQS, S3, Lambda, DynamoDB, etc.), Docker, Github, Grafana, InfluxDB, PHP and Memcache/Redis. We love working with modern tools and sharing our experiences with the community.Data Science & Analytics:As a data science or analytics intern you could help with data models that drive specific product features and drive insights in support of our consumer products across mobile, tablets, web, connected TV, voice and emerging technologies. You will work with big data platforms and statistical, econometric, and/or machine learning techniques to enable product capabilities and features.Product Management & Design:As a product management or design intern you could help shape the strategy and drive the execution and successful delivery of our top-rate TV Everywhere apps across Discovery’s US TV Brands (Discovery Channel, HGTV, Food Network, TLC, Investigation Discovery, Animal Planet and Travel Channel, among others). Your contributions will help in the decision-making process for brands that customers know and love, based on user data and research. You will help with the discovery, development and shipment of products and features that deliver both meaningful benefit to our users and strategic success for our company.RequirementsMust be currently enrolled as a student (proof of enrollment will be required if selected for an internship)Must be a current Junior, Senior, or Graduate studentMust have at least a 3.0 GPAMust have the legal right to work in the United StatesExperience with some of the following: Java, JavaScript, ReactJS, ReactNative, Golang, MariaDB, MongoDB, AWS (SQS, S3, Lambda, DynamoDB, etc.), Docker, Github, Grafana, InfluxDB, PHP and Memcache/RedisExperience with some of the following: SQL, Apache Spark, Hadopp, AWS (Redshift, S3, EC2, EMR)Please submit your resume for general consideration for future opportunities in these areas.We will be in contact should an opportunity open that matches your interests.bellevue, washington, seattle

88.title: Intern - Software Engineer (Development & Testing)
88.body: All submissions MUST include GPA for consideration.Corvid Technologies is seeking qualified candidates for an internship working with our Ballistic Missile Defense (BMD) Group. The BMD Group supports a variety of government (Missile Defense Agency, Navy Missile Defense) programs through modeling and simulation, testing, and system analysis related to the defense of the homeland and military assets from ballistic missile threats. Corvid’s BMD analysis includes missile intercept modeling using first-principle physics codes, aerodynamic modeling of missiles and debris, development of finite element models, computational electromagnetics modeling, modeling of BMDS radars, modeling of BMDS interceptor seekers, and analysis of BMDS sensor data (RF and EO/IR).Example ResponsibilitiesCoordinating all activities related to setup and maintenance of the development test environmentWork directly with developers to write complex test casesIdentify and troubleshoot possible problemsEnsure the overall quality of the productBasic QualificationsA candidate must meet ALL of the below criteria. The candidate must:Be a student who is enrolled full-time and pursuing an undergraduate or graduate (preferred) degree from an accredited college/university AND graduating after August 2020Be majoring in Software Engineering, Computer Science or related field.Have an overall cumulative GPA of 3.0/4.0 or higher (unofficial academic transcripts must be provided at time of application by uploading the documents to your application or profile)Be available to work full-time (40 hours per week) for at least 10 weeks during summer.Be able to obtain a U.S. Government security clearance (U.S. citizenship is a pre-requisite)PreferredHave an overall cumulative GPA of 3.70/4.0 or higherExperience with scientific programming languages (e.g. Matlab, Python, C++)Experience with modeling and simulation softwareStrong background in object-oriented programming; Knowledge of Visual Studio Code, LinuxPrevious internship/co-op experience, leadership & teamwork capabilities, interpersonal communication skills, and activities (professional/community/extracurricular)About Corvid:Corvid is a small business that provides technology-based solutions to a diverse customer base ranging from the Missile Defense Agency to NASCAR. We are a group of over 140 engineers and scientists, about 3/4ths with master’s degrees or Ph.D.’s, that provide end-to-end solutions including concept development, design and optimization, prototype build, test, and manufacture. We leverage the predictive capability of our high-fidelity computational physics solvers, indigenous massively parallel supercomputer system, prototyping plant, and ballistics and mechanics lab to investigate a variety of high-rate physics phenomena. The results are complex engineering solutions for a variety of applications; aircraft, ballistic missile defense, motorsports, armor development, biological systems, and missile and warhead design and development. These results are achieved with optimal design and cost efficiency due to the predictive capability of Corvid’s tools and our in-house, end-to-end integrated approach, which differentiates Corvid from the market. Please visit our website for more information, www.corvidtec.comAll qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.Job Type: InternshipLocation:Huntsville, AL (Required)License:U.S. SECRET or TOP SECRET Security Clearance (Required)Work authorization:United States (Required)

93.title: Business Automation Application Developer - Coding Skills Non-Mandatory
93.body: We are the developer of the world-leading, next-generation, no-to-low-code application platform that enables organizations to rapidly create hundreds to thousands of new business automation applications to accelerate the transformation into a digital business.“In short, Software is eating the world.” – Marc Andreessen“Every business will become a software business . . .” – Satya Nadella, CEO, Microsoft“Every business is, willingly or unwillingly, a competitor on a software playing field . . .” - Harvard Business ReviewThe sheer demand to modernize existing legacy applications and create new ones go way beyond what we can expect from the capacity of traditional IT and newThe no-to-low-code development trend emerged to revolutionize software development and enable cross-discipline innovation. Many low-code platforms only aim to deliver higher development productivity for IT by leveraging prior code-generation techniques. Our platform aims to also democratize the application development to empower business subject matter experts (or Citizens Developers) to innovate while collaborating with IT.Read more about our platform: https://drive.google.com/open?id=1vdSIQoZqyXucoatzBOwQeCnKE3iIo9hGRead how ‘Turning Application Development Upside Down’ is the future -https://drive.google.com/open?id=1l5ma87iWM2TrlC-GY7SwX1YiLu7xd7QoAs a market leader, we faced a strong demand for a new generation of business-minded application developers to best leverage the empowerment and the innovation no-to-low-code trend can bring. We are looking for highly motivated, self-driven young graduates to join us. You will go through a 3-month training to learn this latest innovation until you can develop business applications, without coding, for our customers.If you are a developer, we also need you. You will be part of enhancing and expanding our no-to-low-code platform (yes, with coding) so we can continue to push the envelope by adding more advanced functionality with no-code ease of use.If interested, please reply with a cover letter and a copy of your resume.Join us and experience the power of the future.Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Internship, ContractSalary: $50,000.00 to $90,000.00 /yearExperience:Business Analysis: 1 year (Preferred)

107.title: Intern - Software Engineer (Development & Testing)
107.body: All submissions MUST include GPA for consideration.Corvid Technologies is seeking qualified candidates for an internship working with our Ballistic Missile Defense (BMD) Group. The BMD Group supports a variety of government (Missile Defense Agency, Navy Missile Defense) programs through modeling and simulation, testing, and system analysis related to the defense of the homeland and military assets from ballistic missile threats. Corvid’s BMD analysis includes missile intercept modeling using first-principle physics codes, aerodynamic modeling of missiles and debris, development of finite element models, computational electromagnetics modeling, modeling of BMDS radars, modeling of BMDS interceptor seekers, and analysis of BMDS sensor data (RF and EO/IR).Example ResponsibilitiesCoordinating all activities related to setup and maintenance of the development test environmentWork directly with developers to write complex test casesIdentify and troubleshoot possible problemsEnsure the overall quality of the productBasic QualificationsA candidate must meet ALL of the below criteria. The candidate must:Be a student who is enrolled full-time and pursuing an undergraduate or graduate (preferred) degree from an accredited college/university AND graduating after August 2020Be majoring in Software Engineering, Computer Science or related field.Have an overall cumulative GPA of 3.0/4.0 or higher (unofficial academic transcripts must be provided at time of application by uploading the documents to your application or profile)Be available to work full-time (40 hours per week) for at least 10 weeks during summer.Be able to obtain a U.S. Government security clearance (U.S. citizenship is a pre-requisite)PreferredHave an overall cumulative GPA of 3.70/4.0 or higherExperience with scientific programming languages (e.g. Matlab, Python, C++)Experience with modeling and simulation softwareStrong background in object-oriented programming; Knowledge of Visual Studio Code, LinuxPrevious internship/co-op experience, leadership & teamwork capabilities, interpersonal communication skills, and activities (professional/community/extracurricular)About Corvid:Corvid is a small business that provides technology-based solutions to a diverse customer base ranging from the Missile Defense Agency to NASCAR. We are a group of over 140 engineers and scientists, about 3/4ths with master’s degrees or Ph.D.’s, that provide end-to-end solutions including concept development, design and optimization, prototype build, test, and manufacture. We leverage the predictive capability of our high-fidelity computational physics solvers, indigenous massively parallel supercomputer system, prototyping plant, and ballistics and mechanics lab to investigate a variety of high-rate physics phenomena. The results are complex engineering solutions for a variety of applications; aircraft, ballistic missile defense, motorsports, armor development, biological systems, and missile and warhead design and development. These results are achieved with optimal design and cost efficiency due to the predictive capability of Corvid’s tools and our in-house, end-to-end integrated approach, which differentiates Corvid from the market. Please visit our website for more information, www.corvidtec.comAll qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.Job Type: InternshipLocation:Huntsville, AL (Required)License:U.S. SECRET or TOP SECRET Security Clearance (Required)Work authorization:United States (Required)

109.title: Application Development Intern
109.body: Are you ready to spend your summer as a part of something special? Imagine being with a company whose reputation for excellence paves the way for endless success. At Genuine Parts Company (GPC), people build long-lasting, highly satisfying careers and make a real difference in the community.GPC has been driving success for over 90 years due to a family of 50,000+ dedicated, intelligent, and innovative employees. But this is the best part – all our businesses throughout the world emphasize the growth and development of our team members by providing opportunities for mentorship and advancement.The role:This is the ideal role for a student who is searching for challenging and exciting projects, professional growth, and fun networking opportunities with a Fortune 200 company. As an Application Development Intern at GPC, you’ll have the opportunity to develop a mobile application to assist in streamlining the user experience for NAPA warehouse employees while learning about a global distribution organization.This is the right opportunity for you if you:Enjoy using technical skills to create applications and streamline processesThrive and excel with challenging deadlines and managing multiple prioritiesWant to learn how a global leader in the distribution of automotive parts, industrial parts, and office products operates day-to-dayA day in the life:Write a mobile application to monitor the status of order-picking and scan-delivering items from a Napa Distribution Center to a NAPA StoreAssist in converting old-fashion telnet screens to more modern HTML5 and Javascript touch-capable screens on Android-based scannersCreate deployment packages for remotely installing software on devices and configure software to lock down devicesWhat’s in it for you:Participate in biweekly Lunch and Learn events with company leadersAttend a Braves game and volunteer time with fellow internsExplore the history of the company through a multi-day orientation, complete with a tour of the Atlanta Distribution CenterPresent your summer project to fellow interns and GPC executivesWhat you’ll need:Currently enrolled in an undergraduate or graduate program, seeking degree in Computer Science or related fieldExcellent verbal and written communication skillsAnd if you have this, even better:Strong software development skills in any languagePast experience writing Android applicationsWhy GPC may just be the right place for you:Stable Fortune 200 company with a “family” cultureEnvironment that works hard, yet takes care of employeesOpportunity for accessing multiple career pathsOngoing training and development, with support from leaders and your teamAdditional information for you:GPC has great careers for people with all backgrounds and interests. So, if after reading this, you don’t think this is the perfect fit for you, check out the list of the other opportunities we have at jobs.genpt.com.

111.title: Business Automation Application Developer - Coding Skills Non-Mandatory
111.body: We are the developer of the world-leading, next-generation, no-to-low-code application platform that enables organizations to rapidly create hundreds to thousands of new business automation applications to accelerate the transformation into a digital business.“In short, Software is eating the world.” – Marc Andreessen“Every business will become a software business . . .” – Satya Nadella, CEO, Microsoft“Every business is, willingly or unwillingly, a competitor on a software playing field . . .” - Harvard Business ReviewThe sheer demand to modernize existing legacy applications and create new ones go way beyond what we can expect from the capacity of traditional IT and newThe no-to-low-code development trend emerged to revolutionize software development and enable cross-discipline innovation. Many low-code platforms only aim to deliver higher development productivity for IT by leveraging prior code-generation techniques. Our platform aims to also democratize the application development to empower business subject matter experts (or Citizens Developers) to innovate while collaborating with IT.Read more about our platform: https://drive.google.com/open?id=1vdSIQoZqyXucoatzBOwQeCnKE3iIo9hGRead how ‘Turning Application Development Upside Down’ is the future -https://drive.google.com/open?id=1l5ma87iWM2TrlC-GY7SwX1YiLu7xd7QoAs a market leader, we faced a strong demand for a new generation of business-minded application developers to best leverage the empowerment and the innovation no-to-low-code trend can bring. We are looking for highly motivated, self-driven young graduates to join us. You will go through a 3-month training to learn this latest innovation until you can develop business applications, without coding, for our customers.If you are a developer, we also need you. You will be part of enhancing and expanding our no-to-low-code platform (yes, with coding) so we can continue to push the envelope by adding more advanced functionality with no-code ease of use.If interested, please reply with a cover letter and a copy of your resume.Join us and experience the power of the future.Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Internship, ContractSalary: $50,000.00 to $90,000.00 /yearExperience:Business Analysis: 1 year (Preferred)

112.title: Spring 2020- App Developer Internship
112.body: POSITION SUMMARYThe Application Developer is responsible for developing software applications solutions for ADP's external and internal clients. Application Developers may be involved in all aspects of the software development life cycle (SDLC). Application Developers work with clients, product managers analysts, architects and engineers to plan, design, develop, test and implement information technology solutions consistent with the business objective.Application Developers may develop and review requirements, create design documents, write programs, package, test, configure and deploy software. Application Developers also participate and collaborate with other stakeholder including security, quality assurance, training, project management, engineering, hosting, & procurement when required to assist in other aspects of their projects.Application Developers at ADP are expected to be results-oriented, have knowledge of new and legacy technologies, have knowledge of the relevant platforms and environments, and be familiar with business process, functions and data within their domain to provide innovative, insightful, and secure solutions.We strive for every interaction to be driven by our CORE values: Insightful Expertise, Integrity is Everything, Service Excellence, Inspiring Innovation, Each Person Counts, Results-Driven, & Social Responsibility.RESPONSIBILITIES:Develop & enhance effective programs & data structures that successfully meet the objective.Participate effectively in relevant aspects of software development life cycle (SDLC) including planning, construction, testing, reviews and demonstrations.Collaborate with team to design, develop, test and refine deliverables.Investigate and resolve application issues as needed Package, configure and deploying software Collaborate with clients, Product Managers, Architects, & Analysts to develop and review requirements & design.Review and create system, software and functional design specifications that address requirements.Participate in project planning and release management.Higher level jobs would be expected to manage broader or multiple projects at a time.Acts as an expert source of technology and application knowledge within their domain. Research, recommend, and introduce new technologies and new uses of existing technologies Participating in Business planning, IT strategy and setting direction.Performs other related duties as assigned. 10-20% Travel required.Some situations may require more travels.Must be available to work evenings and weekends as needed.QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED:Technical Degree or equivalent in education & experience.3 - 5 years of directly related experience.Technical experience with Object Oriented Design and Development (Java, C++, etc), Web Technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, JSP, etc)Preference will be given to candidates who have the following:Technical Degree or equivalent in education & experience.3 - 5 years of directly related experience.Technical experience with Object Oriented Design and Development (Java, C++, etc), Web Technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, JSP, etc)Preference will be given to candidates who have the following:Web Application Development Background Experience with Relational Databases, scripting languages, UI / User Interface development experience and related technologies preferred.Uses resources to resolve routine issues regarding technology & business Resolves issues regarding relationships & leadership on own meritRelated Searches:Engineer Analyst Architect Data Scientist Application Developer Design Implementation Chief Principal Enterprise Specialist Infrastructure Research Development R&D Tech Associate Service Solutions Business Intelligence BI System Analyst Disaster Recovery Change Control IT Operations Information Performance Product Production QA Quality Assurance Release Service Statutory UX UI User Experience Interface Researcher Designer Service Project Software Test Program Programmer I&ORelated Searches:Engineer Analyst Architect Data Scientist Application Developer Design Implementation Chief Principal Enterprise Specialist Infrastructure Research Development R&D Tech Associate Service Solutions Business Intelligence BI System Analyst Disaster Recovery Change Control IT Operations Information Performance Product Production QA Quality Assurance Release Service Statutory UX UI User Experience Interface Researcher Designer Service Project Software Test Program Programmer I&OWe're designing a better way to work, so you can achieve what you're working for. Consistently named one of the 'Most Admired Companies' by FORTUNE® Magazine, and recognized by DiversityInc® as one of the 'Top 50 Companies for Diversity,' ADP works with more than 740,000 organizations across the globe to help their people work smarter, embrace new challenges, and unleash their talent. "Always Designing for People" means we're creating platforms that will transform how great work gets done, so together we can unlock a world of opportunity.At ADP, we believe that diversity fuels innovation. ADP is committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, genetic information, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, lawful alien status, national origin, age, marital status, or protected veteran status. We support an inclusive workplace where associates excel based on personal merit, qualifications, experience, ability, and job performance.
